Out[8]: 1.0

In [9]: rv = stats.norm(loc=5, scale=0.5)

In [10]: rv.mean()
Out[10]: 5.0

In [11]: rv.std()
Out[11]: 0.5

(array([0.00132872, 0.        , 0.00265744, 0.00797232, 0.00265744,

In [91]: y1 = rv1.cdf(x)

In [92]: y2 = rv2.cdf(x)

In [93]: y = 0.5*y1 + 0.5*y2

In [94]: ax.plot(x, y, '-')
Out[94]: [<matplotlib.lines.Line2D at 0x7f7c22d6c7f0>]

         4.  ,  4.25,  4.5 ,  4.75,  5.  ,  5.25,  5.5 ,  5.75]),
 <a list of 43 Patch objects>)

In [202]: ax.hist(treatment, bins=edges, label='Treatment')
Out[202]:
(array([ 0.,  1.,  1.,  5.,  4.,  7., 15., 13., 17., 30., 25., 29., 28.,
        29., 17., 28., 18.,  9., 14., 10., 13., 17., 14., 18., 16., 21.,
        24., 32., 25., 34., 19., 20., 16.,  8.,  9.,  5.,  4.,  4.,  0.,
         0.,  0.,  0.,  1.]),

In [203]: ax.legend()
Out[203]: <matplotlib.legend.Legend at 0x7f7c22720320>

In [204]: u, p = stats.mannwhitneyu(control, treatment)

In [205]: p
Out[205]: 0.3793602602168199

In [206]: d, p = stats.ks_2samp(control, treatment)

In [207]: p
Out[207]: 3.1086244689504383e-15

In [208]: t, p = stats.ttest_ind(control, treatment, equal_var=False)

In [209]: p
Out[209]: 0.8571390941091492

In [210]: k, p = stats.kstest(control, 'norm')

In [211]: p
Out[211]: 5.510340001953806e-13

In [212]: mu = control.mean()

In [213]: mu
Out[213]: 0.008304453009214516

In [214]: sigma = control.std()

In [215]: sigma
Out[215]: 0.5049476620857668

In [216]: k, p = stats.kstest(control, 'norm', args=(mu, sigma))

In [217]: p
Out[217]: 0.8599828043741626

In [218]: mu = treatment.mean()

In [219]: sigma = treatment.std()

In [220]: k, p = stats.kstest(treatment, 'norm', args=(mu, sigma))

In [221]: p
Out[221]: 4.010923227537854e-05

In [222]: mu
Out[222]: -0.008446414205792034

In [223]: sigma
Out[223]: 2.208267926505711
